poem:
"In the Midst of Procrastination"

Silent masses hold 
receipts crumpled like frail petals,
a deadline springs, voracious.

Alas, tax forms lie
blank as winter's breath,
awaiting the imprint of digits.

An "act now" plea echoes,
hangs heavy as embattled fog,
stirs movement in still corners.

Unseen interest usurps, a gainful thief,
The clock's harsh tick - cruel reminder,
awaiting the stroke of thirty-first.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Almost 4 million people yet to file UK tax return due on 31 January Almost 4 million people have yet to file their self-assessment tax return, even though the deadline is just eight days away – prompting HM Revenue and Customs to issue an “act now” plea designed to chivvy people into action. Those who miss the deadline potentially face penalties including late payment interest at a rate of 7.75% – the highest for 16". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
